items.title: Craig Mod — Things Become Other Things
items.summary:
Does listening to an audiobook count as "reading"? I'm not sure it does. Either way, I listened to Craig Mod reading his (audio)book Things Become Other Things while working in the yard. Craig made the opposite move from me, he emigrated from the US. I immigrated here instead. It felt perfectly appropriate to listen to Craig's story while tending to my little suburban piece of America.

Go give it a listen, or read the actual book. I highly recommend it. If you listen to the audiobook, don't miss the photos, they're in the extras.
items.content_html:

items.title: The Vignelli Canon
items.summary: I recently reread The Vignelli Canon, still as great and inspiring as ever.
items.content_html: I recently reread The Vignelli Canon, still as great and inspiring as ever.

items.title: ClearMark Award: Show Me for Emergencies
items.summary: I don't usually get too excited about winning industry awards. Making digital products better isn't — and shouldn't be — a competition. That said, the Show Me for Emergencies app (Android, iOS) deserves all the recognition and promotion it can get. It was an honor and a pleasure to be a part of the team bringing this to life.
items.content_html: I don't usually get too excited about winning industry awards. Making digital products better isn't — and shouldn't be — a competition. That said, the Show Me for Emergencies app (Android, iOS) deserves all the recognition and promotion it can get. It was an honor and a pleasure to be a part of the team bringing this to life.

items.title: Dataviz: Information is Beautiful
items.summary: I love fun, creative, data visualization. Information is Beautiful is a source of endless inspiration. This interactive visualization of how true "based on a true story" films actually are, is a great example.
items.content_html: I love fun, creative, data visualization. Information is Beautiful is a source of endless inspiration. This interactive visualization of how true "based on a true story" films actually are, is a great example.

items.title: Bite-sized book review: Slow Productivity
items.summary: Bite-sized book review: Cal Newport — Slow Productivity | A promising premise. But ultimately disappointing. At least it was short and entertaining.
items.content_html: Bite-sized book review: Cal Newport — Slow Productivity | A promising premise. But ultimately disappointing. At least it was short and entertaining.

items.title: NYC transit map
items.summary: I'll always be a bit nostalgic for the NYC subway map I used when I lived there. But as a fan of Massimo Vignelli, I love that the new design is reminiscent of the 1972 Unimark map.
items.content_html: I'll always be a bit nostalgic for the NYC subway map I used when I lived there. But as a fan of Massimo Vignelli, I love that the new design is reminiscent of the 1972 Unimark map.

items.title: Owls in Towels
items.summary: As a health communicator and a user experience designer, I fully endorse this. Owls in towels is a great website.
items.content_html: As a health communicator and a user experience designer, I fully endorse this. Owls in towels is a great website.

items.title: Healthy People LHI Infographics
items.summary:
Together with our client ODPHP, we recently launched dynamic and interactive infographics for Healthy People 2030 Leading Health Indicators.

This was a fun data visualization challenge. I'm so lucky to work with a great team of people who help me execute my (sometimes hare-brained) ideas.
